meanings.definition: To deprive a man of his male role or identity.
meanings.sent1: The villain's plan was to emasculate the hero by belittling him in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: The traditional gender roles in the play were challenged when the male character faced emasculation.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the superhero's emasculation when he lost his cape and powers.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the final battle symbolized the emasculation of the once mighty warrior.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fallen king captured the essence of emasculation in the face of defeat.

meanings.definition: To weaken or undermine someone's power or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism from his boss began to emasculate his self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments online were starting to emasculate her enthusiasm for the project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank was meant to playfully emasculate his authority in the office.
meanings.sent4: The relentless challenges at work felt like a slow emasculation of his leadership skills.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal by his closest friend was a brutal form of emotional emasculation.
